verses.kjv: Then all the children of Israel went out, and the congregation was gathered together as one man, from Dan even to Beersheba, with the land of Gilead, unto the LORD in Mizpeh.
verses.ct: Then all the Israelites came out, and the entire community assembled as one — from Dan all the way to Beersheba, including those from the region of Gilead — gathering before the LORD at Mizpeh.

verses.kjv: And the chief of all the people, even of all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand footmen that drew sword.
verses.ct: The leaders of all the tribes of Israel took their places in the assembly of God's people. There were 400,000 sword-bearing foot soldiers.

verses.kjv: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel were gone up to Mizpeh.) Then said the children of Israel, Tell us, how was this wickedness?
verses.ct: (The people of Benjamin had heard that the Israelites had gone up to Mizpeh.) The Israelites said, "Tell us — how did this terrible thing happen?"

verses.kjv: And the Levite, the husband of the woman that was slain, answered and said, I came into Gibeah that belongeth to Benjamin, I and my concubine, to lodge.
verses.ct: The Levite, the husband of the murdered woman, answered, "My secondary wife and I came to Gibeah in Benjamin's territory to spend the night.

verses.kjv: And the men of Gibeah rose against me, and beset the house round about upon me by night, and thought to have slain me: and my concubine have they forced, that she is dead.
verses.ct: During the night, the men of Gibeah came after me. They surrounded the house, intending to kill me. Instead, they violated my secondary wife so brutally that she died.

verses.kjv: And I took my concubine, and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel: for they have committed lewdness and folly in Israel.
verses.ct: I took her body, cut it into pieces, and sent them throughout the entire territory of Israel, because these men committed a disgusting and outrageous act in Israel.

verses.kjv: Behold, ye are all children of Israel; give here your advice and counsel.
verses.ct: All of you here are Israelites — give your judgment and decide what should be done."

verses.kjv: And all the people arose as one man, saying, We will not any of us go to his tent, neither will we any of us turn into his house.
verses.ct: The entire assembly rose up united and declared, "Not one of us will go home. None of us will return to our houses.

verses.kjv: But now this shall be the thing which we will do to Gibeah; we will go up by lot against it;
verses.ct: Here is what we will do to Gibeah — we will attack it, selecting our forces by drawing lots.

verses.kjv: And we will take ten men of an hundred throughout all the tribes of Israel, and an hundred of a thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand, to fetch victual for the people, that they may do, when they come to Gibeah of Benjamin, according to all the folly that they have wrought in Israel.
verses.ct: We will take 10 men out of every 100 from all the tribes of Israel, 100 out of every 1,000, and 1,000 out of every 10,000, to gather food for the army, so that when they reach Gibeah of Benjamin, they can punish them for the outrageous thing they did in Israel."

verses.kjv: So all the men of Israel were gathered against the city, knit together as one man.
verses.ct: So all the men of Israel gathered against the city, completely united.

verses.kjv: And the tribes of Israel sent men through all the tribe of Benjamin, saying, What wickedness is this that is done among you?
verses.ct: The tribes of Israel sent messengers throughout the entire tribe of Benjamin, asking, "What is this terrible crime that has been committed among you?

verses.kjv: Now therefore deliver us the men, the children of Belial, which are in Gibeah, that we may put them to death, and put away evil from Israel. But the children of Benjamin would not hearken to the voice of their brethren the children of Israel:
verses.ct: Now hand over those worthless men in Gibeah so we can execute them and purge this evil from Israel." But the people of Benjamin refused to listen to their fellow Israelites.

verses.kjv: But the children of Benjamin gathered themselves together out of the cities unto Gibeah, to go out to battle against the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Instead, the Benjaminites gathered from their towns and assembled at Gibeah to go to war against the rest of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin were numbered at that time out of the cities twenty and six thousand men that drew sword, beside the inhabitants of Gibeah, which were numbered seven hundred chosen men.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites mobilized 26,000 sword-bearing soldiers from their towns that day, in addition to 700 specially selected warriors from the residents of Gibeah itself.

verses.kjv: Among all this people there were seven hundred chosen men lefthanded; every one could sling stones at an hair breadth, and not miss.
verses.ct: Among all these troops were 700 specially selected left-handed men, each of whom could sling a stone at a hair's width and never miss.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel, beside Benjamin, were numbered four hundred thousand men that drew sword: all these were men of war.
verses.ct: The men of Israel, not counting Benjamin, numbered 400,000 sword-bearing soldiers — all experienced fighters.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel arose, and went up to the house of God, and asked counsel of God, and said, Which of us shall go up first to the battle against the children of Benjamin? And the LORD said, Judah shall go up first.
verses.ct: The Israelites went up to Bethel and consulted God, asking, "Which tribe should lead the attack against Benjamin?" The LORD answered, "Judah will go first."

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel rose up in the morning, and encamped against Gibeah.
verses.ct: The Israelites got up the next morning and set up camp near Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel went out to battle against Benjamin; and the men of Israel put themselves in array to fight against them at Gibeah.
verses.ct: The men of Israel marched out to fight Benjamin and took their battle positions against them at Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin came forth out of Gibeah, and destroyed down to the ground of the Israelites that day twenty and two thousand men.
verses.ct: But the Benjaminites charged out of Gibeah and cut down 22,000 Israelites on the ground that day.

verses.kjv: And the people the men of Israel encouraged themselves, and set their battle again in array in the place where they put themselves in array the first day.
verses.ct: The Israelite army rallied their courage and formed their battle lines again in the same place where they had positioned themselves the first day.

verses.kjv: (And the children of Israel went up and wept before the LORD until even, and asked counsel of the LORD, saying, Shall I go up again to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother? And the LORD said, Go up against him.)
verses.ct: (The Israelites had gone up and wept in the LORD's presence until evening, and they asked the LORD, "Should we go fight against our relatives in Benjamin again?" The LORD answered, "Go up against them.")

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel came near against the children of Benjamin the second day.
verses.ct: So the Israelites advanced against the Benjaminites on the second day.

verses.kjv: And Benjamin went forth against them out of Gibeah the second day, and destroyed down to the ground of the children of Israel again eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword.
verses.ct: Benjamin came out from Gibeah to meet them on the second day and cut down another 18,000 Israelite soldiers — all of them armed fighters.

verses.kjv: Then all the children of Israel, and all the people, went up, and came unto the house of God, and wept, and sat there before the LORD, and fasted that day until even, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the LORD.
verses.ct: Then all the Israelites — the entire army — went up to Bethel. They wept and sat in the LORD's presence, fasting until evening, and they presented burnt offerings and peace offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel enquired of the LORD, (for the ark of the covenant of God was there in those days,
verses.ct: The Israelites sought guidance from the LORD (the ark of God's covenant was there in those days,

verses.kjv: And Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it in those days,) saying, Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease? And the LORD said, Go up; for to morrow I will deliver them into thine hand.
verses.ct: and Phinehas son of Eleazar, the grandson of Aaron, was serving before it at that time), asking, "Should we go out once more to fight against our relatives in Benjamin, or should we stop?" The LORD answered, "Go up, because tomorrow I will give you victory over them."

verses.kjv: And Israel set liers in wait round about Gibeah.
verses.ct: So Israel positioned soldiers in ambush all around Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel went up against the children of Benjamin on the third day, and put themselves in array against Gibeah, as at other times.
verses.ct: The Israelites advanced against Benjamin on the third day and took up battle positions against Gibeah just as they had done before.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to smite of the people, and kill, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goeth up to the house of God, and the other to Gibeah in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites came out to engage the Israelite forces and were drawn away from the city. They began striking down some of the Israelites as before, killing about 30 men along the roads — one leading up to Bethel and the other to Gibeah through the open country.

verses.kjv: And the children of Benjamin said, They are smitten down before us, as at the first. But the children of Israel said, Let us flee, and draw them from the city unto the highways.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites said, "We're defeating them just like before!" But the Israelites had planned, "Let's retreat and lure them away from the city onto the roads."

verses.kjv: And all the men of Israel rose up out of their place, and put themselves in array at Baaltamar: and the liers in wait of Israel came forth out of their places, even out of the meadows of Gibeah.
verses.ct: The main Israelite force pulled back from their positions and regrouped at Baal-tamar, while the Israelite ambush force rushed out from their hiding places west of Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And there came against Gibeah ten thousand chosen men out of all Israel, and the battle was sore: but they knew not that evil was near them.
verses.ct: Then 10,000 of Israel's best soldiers launched a direct assault on Gibeah. The fighting was fierce, but the Benjaminites had no idea that disaster was closing in on them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD smote Benjamin before Israel: and the children of Israel destroyed of the Benjamites that day twenty and five thousand and an hundred men: all these drew the sword.
verses.ct: The LORD defeated Benjamin before Israel, and the Israelites killed 25,100 Benjaminite soldiers that day — all of them armed fighters.

verses.kjv: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were smitten: for the men of Israel gave place to the Benjamites, because they trusted unto the liers in wait which they had set beside Gibeah.
verses.ct: The Benjaminites realized they were beaten. The Israelite main force had given ground to Benjamin on purpose, because they were counting on the ambush they had set up near Gibeah.

verses.kjv: And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Gibeah; and the liers in wait drew themselves along, and smote all the city with the edge of the sword.
verses.ct: The ambush force moved quickly and rushed into Gibeah. They spread out and killed everyone in the city with their swords.

verses.kjv: Now there was an appointed sign between the men of Israel and the liers in wait, that they should make a great flame with smoke rise up out of the city.
verses.ct: The prearranged signal between the main Israelite army and the ambush force was that a large column of smoke would rise from the city.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Israel retired in the battle, Benjamin began to smite and kill of the men of Israel about thirty persons: for they said, Surely they are smitten down before us, as in the first battle.
verses.ct: When the Israelite main force had pulled back during the battle, Benjamin had begun striking them down, killing about 30 Israelites. They were saying, "We're clearly defeating them again, just like the first battle!"

verses.kjv: But when the flame began to arise up out of the city with a pillar of smoke, the Benjamites looked behind them, and, behold, the flame of the city ascended up to heaven.
verses.ct: But then the column of smoke began rising from the city. The Benjaminites looked back and saw the entire city going up in flames toward the heavens.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Israel turned again, the men of Benjamin were amazed: for they saw that evil was come upon them.
verses.ct: At that moment the Israelite main force turned around to attack, and the men of Benjamin were filled with terror because they realized disaster had overtaken them.

verses.kjv: Therefore they turned their backs before the men of Israel unto the way of the wilderness; but the battle overtook them; and them which came out of the cities they destroyed in the midst of them.
verses.ct: So they turned and fled from the Israelites toward the wilderness, but the battle caught up with them. Meanwhile, the Israelites coming out of the towns were cutting them down from every side.

verses.kjv: Thus they inclosed the Benjamites round about, and chased them, and trode them down with ease over against Gibeah toward the sunrising.
verses.ct: They surrounded the Benjaminites, chased them down, and trampled them relentlessly, all the way past Gibeah toward the east.

verses.kjv: And there fell of Benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were men of valour.
verses.ct: 18,000 Benjaminites fell in battle — all of them brave warriors.

verses.kjv: And they turned and fled toward the wilderness unto the rock of Rimmon: and they gleaned of them in the highways five thousand men; and pursued hard after them unto Gidom, and slew two thousand men of them.
verses.ct: The survivors turned and fled toward the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon. The Israelites picked off 5,000 of them along the roads, then chased them hard all the way to Gidom, killing another 2,000.

verses.kjv: So that all which fell that day of Benjamin were twenty and five thousand men that drew the sword; all these were men of valour.
verses.ct: The total number of Benjaminites who fell that day was 25,000 sword-bearing soldiers — all of them brave warriors.

verses.kjv: But six hundred men turned and fled to the wilderness unto the rock Rimmon, and abode in the rock Rimmon four months.
verses.ct: But 600 men managed to escape and flee into the wilderness to the rock of Rimmon, where they stayed for 4 months.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel turned again upon the children of Benjamin, and smote them with the edge of the sword, as well the men of every city, as the beast, and all that came to hand: also they set on fire all the cities that they came to.
verses.ct: The Israelites then turned back against the rest of the Benjaminites and struck down with the sword everyone they found — people, livestock, and everything else. They also burned every town they came across.
